content:
The provided code snippet is part of a leak detection mechanism in a Python class that tracks changes in container sizes over time to identify potential memory leaks. The chunk specifically checks if the size of a container has consistently grown across three consecutive measurements (diff > 0 for diff, diff2, and diff3), indicating a possible leak. If detected, it retrieves the container's name and attempts to yield its reference.

fastRepr(container, maxLen=CheckContainers.ReprItems)))
                                    yield None

                        if (self._index > 2 and
                            objId in idx2id2len[self._index-2] and
                            objId in idx2id2len[self._index-3]):
                            diff2 = idx2id2len[self._index-1][objId] - idx2id2len[self._index-2][objId]
                            diff3 = idx2id2len[self._index-2][objId] - idx2id2len[self._index-3][objId]
                            if self._index <= 4:
                                if diff > 0 and diff2 > 0 and diff3 > 0:
                                    name = self._leakDetector.getContainerNameById(objId)
                                    try:
                                        for container in self._leakDetector.getContainerByIdGen(objId):
                                            yield None
